column1: L, The Justice Dept on Netroots Radio Presents: "The End of Slavery is a Modern Fiction", justiceputnam, 2021-06-27, I'm Special Agent DJ Justice Radio Host and Managing Partner for Netroots Radio and I'm manning the dials spinning the discs warbling the woofers putting a slip in your hip and a trip to your hop.     Who luvs ya baby? column2: poetry chosen and critiqued by Black Kos Poetry Editor Justice Putnam. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  “I don’t know” I said flatly “what is it?” “It smells like… ” she sniffed in a haughty Parisian disdain “it smells like fascism.” I knew then I was in love with her. I knew it truly. – Justice Putnam “My Little French Honeymoon” ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Question: Who is your audience? What are you here for? Answer: Tribal Alliances Heart-felt Convictions Passionate Reason Random Abandon Sustainable Civility and a kiss
column3: to comfort the sad and the mad Ones
column4: the Ones roaming the International section of the American Supermarket at night
column5: or roaming the neglected streets looking for an angry malaprop to sink their teeth into
column6: the Ones who seek without seeking and learn as much as they teach
column7: the Ones who embrace and kiss and embrace again
column8: the Ones who sing the song of the city and the ballads of the forest
column9: the Ones who chant the rhythm of the sea and hum the melody of the desert
